intro: Desmochaeta lappacea, commonly known as the hairy lappaceae, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually compound, with a hairy texture that provides some protection against herbivores. Desmochaeta lappacea is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
